Senior Analyst Workforce Planning, Strategy & Transformation

Brisbane based ideally but Melbourne considered also
Full time permanent opportunity

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you’ll be doing

The Senior Analyst Workforce Planning Strategy & Transformation position is pivotal in ensuring the optimal balance of operational resources required to deliver a safe, efficient, and customer-centric flight schedule. You will leverage data analytics and modelling to support strategic decision making, evaluate transformation initiatives, and provide actionable insights.

In this role, you will:

Build and maintain accurate resource and budget planning models and long term horizons (6+months)
Apply statistical modelling to assess impacts of schedule changes, headcount, productivity, basing strategies, and fatigue management
Conduct critical analysis of transformational initiatives, including benefit valuation and tracking
Develop and automate reporting on costs, productivity, and capacity using tools such as Excel, Power BI, R, or Python
Research industry trends and operational methodologies to drive continuous improvement
Partner with multiple departments within the business to deliver resource plans
Prepare executive level reports and presentations for senior management within tight timeframes
Identify and implement process improvements, develop business cases, and update procedures as required

You’ll be great in this role if you have…

Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline (Data Science, Analytics preferred)
Proven experience supporting strategic decision making through data analytics
Strong background in solving complex technical problems in fast paced operational environments
Exposure to workforce planning, rostering, or transformational/cost reduction programs
Intermediate coding ability in R, Python or Power BI
Expertise in resource and budget planning within operational contexts
Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to work autonomously
Understanding of resource planning methodologies and airline operations

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):

Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs
One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road

When everyone is included, everyone wins

We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQIA+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

Ready to apply?

We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now.

AEMO at the Heart of Energy

AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner. AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.  




About the Team

AEMO’s System Planning department is focused on efficient planning of the power system over the medium to long term to ensure system security and reliability requirements are met in the National Electricity Market (NEM). The System Planning department is responsible for AEMO’s Integrated System Plan, the 20-year blueprint guiding the future development of the east coast’s power system, as well as system security assessments such as the System Strength Reports and Inertia Reports.




System Planning is also responsible for a range of other engineering assessments and market modelling responsibilities. The team’s analysis can trigger major infrastructure investment, and our advice supports effective decision-making by both industry and government stakeholders. This is a critical function in AEMO’s overall System Design division, engineering a future power system that can securely and efficiently integrate large amounts of renewable energy resources.




About the role - open to Principal and/or Specialist level

As Specialist Analyst– Market Modelling Systems, you’ll provide subject matter expertise and quality assurance, both internally and externally, across major pieces of technical analysis. You will deliver compelling, evidence-based advice to management that influences market modelling performance. This role should lead model development and improvement, and support changes that might impact market modelling software and tools.




What you will be doing

Turn business needs into smart, practical system solutions - managing issue resolution, coordinate upgrades, and ensure modelling platforms stay robust, compliant and fit for purpose.

Provide input to consideration of IT changes and maintain awareness of system changes that may impact market modelling software, tools, and performance.

Scope work packages and manage projects and/or programmes of work to maximise productivity, balancing the need for analytical rigour with timely outcomes, and escalate issues with proposed solutions to senior staff.

Independently identify and act on modelling or methodology improvement opportunities that support team function, bolster future power system operation, or deliver other innovative solutions to complex technical problems.

Lead the management and development of applications and tools used for market modelling data.

Effectively engage with internal and external stakeholders to ensure modelling activities are seamlessly managed across teams, including support for agreement renewals.  




What you will bring to the role

Relevant tertiary or postgraduate qualifications in a related field such as engineering, computer science, physics, or similar.

A wealth of experience in the management of power system applications and automation tools.

Ability to translate business requirements into clear technical specifications and evaluate design and implementation options for modelling portal enhancements.

Skilled in designing, developing and maintaining data pipelines, market models, and visual analytics to deliver actionable insights and support smarter planning decisions.

Strong stakeholder engagement capability, with experience representing technical requirements to external software solution providers and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts in an engaging manner.

In-depth understanding of data governance, including version control, software development life-cycle, and data security.

Demonstrated proficiency in advanced analytical and modelling platforms, including Databricks, PLEXOS, RStudio, Python, and Power BI.




About Our Process 

At AEMO we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome people of all backgrounds, including people with disabilities and neurodivergence and those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. If you have any accessibility requirements to support you during the application or interview process, simply let us know by emailing us at talent@aemo.com.au

Job Title: Manager, Credit Risk Modelling - Integrative Risk
Ad Text:
ING Australia’s Integrative Risk Management team is looking to hire a Manager, Credit Risk Modelling to be based in our Sydney office.

As the Manager, Credit Risk Modelling you will play a critical role in developing, analysing, and monitoring business-critical credit risk models across our retail and wholesale portfolios. You’ll work closely with senior stakeholders and global teams to ensure models are robust, compliant, and deliver insights that drive strategic decision-making.
 

We’re looking for a credit risk modeler who is a data-driven professional with strong quantitative skills, technical expertise, and the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly.

One of the most appealing aspects of working at ING within our modelling centre of excellence is the breadth of exposure you gain. You will get to work across capital, provisioning and credit decisioning models spanning both our retail and wholesale banking portfolios. You will not be fixed in one domain and have the opportunity to shape your own development path and build expertise across multiple domains. You will also get exposure to European regulatory requirements in this role. Our flat organization structure gives you exposure to present to Executives and Board level committees.

It is truly a brilliant place to develop your technical modelling skills as well as your business soft skills / stakeholder skills which are critical to your career.

Ready to make an impact?

What you’ll do  

Responsible for the end-to-end model life cycle, including development, monitoring and navigating models through independent validations.
Develop and maintain regulatory capital and provisioning models in line with Australian, European requirements and internal standards.
Develop and maintain credit risk decision models across application, behavioral, early warning, and collections segmentation models.
Lead projects to assess the impact of business strategy changes on portfolio risk, profitability, and resilience.
Ensure data used for modelling is fit-for-purpose and identify key risk drivers through advanced analytics.
Strengthen our governance and model risk management through high quality documentation, controls and audit readiness across the model suite.

What we’re looking for

Tertiary qualification in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline.
3–5 years’ experience in quantitative credit model development within retail, wholesale or regulatory models.
Strong technical skills in SAS, R, Python, or SQL.
Advanced knowledge of credit risk modelling strategies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to present complex findings to senior stakeholders.
Strong leadership and stakeholder management capabilities.
Desirable: Knowledge of prudential standards and experience with machine learning or AI in model design.

What’s in it for you?

Discounted ING Health Insurance
An additional Rest Day to support your wellbeing
An IMPACT Day to volunteer on approved sustainability activity

When you come to work at ING, you’re joining a team where individuality isn’t just accepted, it’s encouraged. We’ve built a culture that’s fun, friendly and supportive – it’s the kind of place where you can be yourself and make the most of whatever you have to offer. 
 
We give people the freedom to think differently, take ownership of their work, and make great things happen. We’re here to help you get ahead. And with our global network, there’s plenty of scope to take your career in new directions, perhaps even ones you’ve never considered. 
 
We are all about celebrating success and as a result we are proud to be a WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality and a certified Family Inclusive workplace.

KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. KPMG’s Financial Risk Management (FRM) team provides specialist risk management services to a wide range of clients, spanning financial services, energy and corporate sectors. We have an exciting opportunity for a manager to join our growing energy and commodity risk service offering within FRM.

We help our clients with a large range of quantitative risk management services in the areas of energy and commodity trading functions.  As a Manager, you will:

Model Development and Validation – you will work with our clients to develop and implement a range of risk management models.  You will also perform independent model validation for a range of trading and risk management models implemented by our clients.

Trading Controls Assessment – Support our client’s internal audit functions, to ensure that control frameworks around our client’s trading operations are appropriately designed and operating effectively.

How are you extraordinary?

You are able to digest, distil, and communicate complex concepts in both written and verbal forms.

You are a strategic critical thinker, and love using that skill to solve complex problems and plan for the future.

You are able to quickly build strong relationships and network with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external.

Experience and understanding of energy markets, trading and risk (essential)

An interest in working on a diverse range of quantitative and qualitative modelling engagements across energy and commodity markets

Experience using statistical packages such as SAS, R and Python (not mandatory);

An ability to communicate and work with clients and team members, taking on mentoring and management opportunities as appropriate

Senior Technical Business Analyst (NV1 Clearance Required)



Shine Solutions, established in 1998, is an Australian IT consultancy and software development services provider that uses cutting-edge technologies and expertise to create practical, innovative technology solutions. While technology is our craft, our core focus is always on people – our clients and our team. We are a privately owned company with a dedicated team of over 160 consultants and engineers based across Melbourne, Sydney, and Canberra.



When you work at Shine, you will work with a team that:

Loves sharing experiences and learning from each other

Is deeply passionate about all things technology

Supports flexible working arrangements

Encourages further learning opportunities

Challenges you – and encourages you to excel

The Role

We are seeking an experienced and proactive Senior Business Analyst to bridge the gap between our business stakeholders and technical teams for critical AWS infrastructure projects. You will be responsible for understanding business needs, eliciting and documenting requirements, and ensuring that our AWS solutions effectively support our strategic objectives, enhance operational efficiency, and optimize costs.



You'll work closely with Product Owners, Cloud Architects, DevOps Engineers, Security Teams, and business unit leaders to define project scope, analyze requirements, and facilitate the delivery of robust and scalable AWS infrastructure solutions.



You MUST be an Australian Citizen with minimum NV1 security clearance.



Required Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in industry best-practice business analysis techniques (e.g., requirements elicitation, process modeling, use case development, user story writing, acceptance criteria definition).

Proven ability to solve complex business and technical problems, lead sophisticated process modeling (as-is, to-be), conduct thorough user needs analysis, and drive impactful process improvements.

Experience leading others in complex problem-solving and business analysis processes..

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or GCP) and the ability to apply their services to solve business problems.

Ability to collaborate with Cloud Engineers to translate business requirements into technical specifications and solution designs

Expertise in managing scope and scope changes across a backlog, with a keen awareness of the impact of any changes on project timelines, budget

Experience working effectively within Agile/Scrum methodologies and using tools like Jira and Confluence.

Ability to deliver clear, well-structured, and concise arguments to support opinions and recommendations.

Strong facilitation skills, capable of guiding diverse teams (technical, business, leadership) to consensus on scope, design, and implementation decisions for AWS projects.

Ability to build trust quickly and foster positive, influential relationships with client stakeholders, internal teams, and partner stakeholders, leading these relationships where appropriate.

Why Shine?

We put people first. And it pays off.



At Shine, Integrity is more than just a platitude. It’s ingrained in all that we do - from our carbon neutral footprint, to our philanthropic activities to conducting regular reviews of our actions to ensure that we foster a diverse and inclusive workplace.



We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Shine. We believe that creating a diverse team, which includes individuals from different backgrounds and with varying experiences, skills, and perspectives, will drive innovation, creativity, and success.



We’ve created a working environment that respects and nurtures technologists. Our staff engagement rates are significantly higher than industry averages. Our average tenure is also longer. And our staff turnover is lower.



In fact, our engagement rate of 88% places Shine in the top 10% of Professional Services Organisations globally.



How do we do it? By putting you first – always.



What else can you expect?

On top of our one-of-a-kind culture, you’ll also enjoy some tangible perks like:

Funding for approved training programs and certifications, such as AWS and GCP.

can balance strategic thinking with a pragmatic approach to achieving outcomes
